t: Psalm 50
God the Judge of the Righteous and the Wicked.
A Psalm of Asaph.
The*pn Mighty One, God, the Lord,*s has spoken, And*ln summoned the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
Out*ln of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God*ln has shone forth.
May*ln our God come and not keep silence; Fire*ln devours before Him, And*ln it is very tempestuous around Him.
He*ln summons the heavens above, And*ln the earth, to judge His people:
“Gather*ln My godly ones to Me, Those*ln who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
And*ln the heavens declare His righteousness, For*ln God Himself is judge. Selah.
“Hear,*ln O My people, and I will speak; O*ln Israel, I will testify against you; I*ln am God, your God.
I*ln do not reprove you for your sacrifices, And*ln your burnt offerings are continually before Me.
I*ln shall take no young bull out of your house Nor*ln male goats out of your folds.
For*ln every beast of the forest is Mine, The*ln cattle on a thousand hills.
I*ln know every bird of the mountains, And*ln everything that moves in the field is Mine.
If*ln I were hungry I would not tell you, For*ln the world is Mine, and all it contains.
Shall*ln I eat the flesh of bulls Or*ln drink the blood of male goats?
Offer*ln to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving And*ln pay your vows to the Most High;
Call*ln upon Me in the day of trouble; I*ln shall rescue you, and you will honor Me.”
But*ln to the wicked God says, “What*ln right have you to tell of My statutes And*ln to take My covenant in your mouth?
For*ln you hate discipline, And*ln you cast My words behind you.
When*ln you see a thief, you are pleased with him, And*ln you associate with adulterers.
You*ln let your mouth loose in evil And*ln your tongue frames deceit.
You*ln sit and speak against your brother; You*ln slander your own mother’s son.
These*ln things you have done and I kept silence; You*ln thought that I was just like you; I*ln will reprove you and state the*i case*i in order before your eyes.
“Now*ln consider this, you who forget God, Or*ln I will tear you*i in pieces, and there will be none to deliver.
He*ln who offers a sacrifice of thanksgiving honors Me; And*ln to him who orders his*i way aright*i I*ln shall show the salvation of God.”
